intro: Gastrolobium dorrienii, commonly known as the Dorrien's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in full sun. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
